Need to install the Vulkan Wrapper Mod (https://www.nexusmods.com/reddeadredemption/mods/153)
1. Install game normally on your pc
2. extract the vulkan wrapper mod to your games root folder (example: D:\games\red dead redemption\) and allow it to overwrite the existing files
3. Copy the folder to your device and install in gamehub

The game functions correctly and Steam Cloud saves work, but the game struggles to maintain 60fps and has noticeable stuttering.

Other configurations may perform better, however the native Android version of the game may still be preferable.

Install on PC and update using 1.10 patch, use regedit to export your registry entry (Google search will tell you where it is), transfer game and registry to your device. Enter container desktop and use regedit app to import your registry. You will need to setup your controller. Turn on vsync in-game and set resolution. Plays absolutely perfect, as good as on a PC.
Use super resolution with sharpness at 4, force full screen+, set shadows in game to low. Perfect gaming experience.
Minor frame drops but very playable with a pretty good experience
Just like playing it on a PC out of the box
Use super resolution, set sharpness to 4, force fullscreen+, plays almost as smooth as on the Switch.
Smooth gameplay with 60 fps

Gamehub Lite. After ALOT of trying I figured out how to run it. So... 
Compatibility layer: wine10.6-arm64x-2
Translation Params: Performance 
DInput library: Prefer Native
Add all these enviroment variables:
WINEMODE=win10
BOX64_DYNAREC_SAFEFLAGS=1
BOX64_DYNAREC_FASTNAN=1
BOX64_DYNAREC_FASTROUND=0
BOX64_DYNAREC_X87DOUBLE=0
BOX64_DYNAREC_BIGBLOCK=3
BOX64_DYNAREC_STRONGMEM=1
BOX64_DYNAREC_FORWARD=512
BOX64_DYNAREC_CALLRET=1
BOX64_DYNAREC_WAIT=0
BOX64_DYNAREC_NATIVEFLAGS=0
BOX64_DYNAREC_WEAKBARRIER=1
d3dcompiler_43=native,builtin
d3dcompiler_47=native,builtin
xaudio2_7=native,builtin
Install these components:
d3dcompiler_43,d3dcompiler_47,mono,physx,mono10.1.0.

Set Translation Params to extreme or will be very slow.  Once in game, the graphics glitched and I got blue screens after some cut scenes, which corrected as soon as the game progressed to the factory, but other than that the game ran perfectly with great framerates.  The final boss screen glitched at first with a blue screen but I was able to make it playable by setting 'Native Rendering+' to 'Auto' in the in game GameHub config.  Compared to running the switch version on RP5, this has better performance and is fully playable to the end of the secret level

So far I'm 3 hours in, the lowest is around 35 fps reaching all the way up to 55 in less heavy enviroments. It froze only once on me, has autosave so it didn't bother me that much and there are no visual glitches. I'm on rp mini with ds attachement so it was probably due to ram. Never thought I could make this work since I didn't see any video of ACII running this good. Make sure to set the resolution to 854x480 and enable super resolution + sharpness = 1. Don't worry it'll look better than it seems. In game set everything to low, enable post and vsync. I'm using turnip v26.0.0_r2 and fex-20251025 in latest gamehub lite. Translation parameters set to extreme preset and enable TSO memory.

Use 854x480 resolution and enable super resolution + sharpness = 1. It looks great trust me. In game set everything to low, turn to none the settings you can turn off. In translation parameters use extreme preset and enable TSO memory. Using latest gamehub lite. I'm early in game on the second dungeon and so far it's looking really playable. Its a heavy game, the lowest it goes is 27 fps, mainly when there are a lot of buildings and houses in the distance. Highest is 40 fps and mostly it stays between 30-35 fps. I'm on rp mini with ds attachement, didn't crash on me yet. Just the lower screen blacks out when loading (probably due to low ram).
Tried multiple drivers and layers. Runs great until you start playing. Then it just freezes

rows.game: Shadows of the Damned Hella Remastered
rows.notes: I used 30 fps cap, in order to get the best playable experience.

Compatability Layer: proton10.0-arm64x-2
Translation Params: Extreme
Cpu Translator: Fex-20251025

Using Gamehub Lite v5.1.0
Even though Denuvo has been removed, this version of the game still requires some specific settings in order to boot:

    Command line argument: -dx11
    Compatibility layer: wine10.0-x64 (not arm64, game does not load with fex)
    Translation params: Extreme preset, change SafeFlags to 2 and BigBlock to 3
    CPU translator: Latest Box64

In-game graphics settings:

    Texture quality: Medium
    Static Global Illumination: On
    Static Shadow Maps: On
    SSAO: Performance
    Anti-aliasing: FXAA
    Upscaling: Off
    Anisotropic Filtering: x8
    The remaining settings are set to Low or Off.

In Gamehub side menu, Force enable Native Rendering, lock FPS to 40 and turn on Super Resolution.
With these settings, the game runs at a very stable 40FPS with very minor drops.

This was only tested in the first level, some settings may not be optimal and there could be crashes further on that I have not reached. I encourage people to tweak the in-game visual settings to reach the balance between graphics quality and performance for different devices.
